intro: Castilleja fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its reddish-orange to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with other plants, drawing nutrients from them. Castilleja fasciculata is often found in association with grasses and shrubs, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its environment.
